metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9448 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The TIFFFetchNormalTag function in LibTiff 4.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) by setting the tags TIFF_SETGET_C16ASCII or TIFF_SETGET_C32_ASCII to values that access 0-byte arrays.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-9297.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Introduced by fix for CVE-2016-9297 mdeslaur> this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
